text: And just like that, 2024 at NYU Shanghai is complete! We connected through on and off-campus events, welcomed esteemed guests, got creative, showcased our talents, and learned so much this year--from the classroom to the city and beyond! #HappyNewYear, NYU Shanghai! 💜🥳

Relive the excitement of the Sino-Foreign University Cup with NYU Shanghai’s athletes showcasing their talent, teamwork, and determination! Our athletes brought their A-game and embodied the spirit of sportsmanship at this competition hosted on campus. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wKfdashwGRo&t=4s&ab_channel=NYUShanghai

Students taking advanced Chinese language courses showcased their skills during final poster presentations, covering everything from China’s takeout delivery business to the integration of Mandarin into American culture. We loved how our community came together to support them!

Finals week is here, but remember—it’s more than exams and essays. From photography and visual arts exhibitions to unforgettable music and dance performances, your hard work and creativity are shining brightly. Keep going, Qilins! 💪🌟 https://shanghai.nyu.edu/photos/few-scenes-fall-2024-end-semester-shows

Students from all over the globe had the chance to discuss creativity and diplomacy with U.S. Ambassador @USAmbChina Nicholas Burns during his visit to NYU Shanghai. https://shanghai.nyu.edu/news/us-ambassador-china-nicholas-burns-visits-nyu-shanghai

Congratulations to Ruby Rich ’24, who is currently pursuing a @FulbrightPrgrm Austria English Teaching Assistantship! 🌟Ruby, a Social Science graduate, inspires students aged 10 to 18 by blending education with cultural exchange. https://shanghai.nyu.edu/news/ruby-rich-24-pursues-fulbright-eta-austria

As the semester comes to a close, faculty and students share their experiences in some of the most innovative new courses on offer this year from Topics in Machine Learning-Deep Learning to Good Death: China and Comparative Perspectives. https://shanghai.nyu.edu/news/exciting-new-courses-offer-nyu-shanghai

"Students often ask me questions after class. I like that. Working with them reminds me of the way I worked with my advisors," says Mingyuan Wang. "We can pick up a pen and discuss any problems anytime." https://shanghai.nyu.edu/is/what-im-working-wang-mingyuan-cryptography

NYU Shanghai Reads closed the semester with a powerful performance inspired by Braiding Sweetgrass: Indigenous Wisdom, Scientific Knowledge by Robin Wall Kimmerer. 🎭 Playback Theatre (还原剧) troupe members used audience members’ stories to reveal nature's healing magic.🍓

NYU Shanghai’s Qilins showed off their athleticism and sportsmanship in basketball, badminton, volleyball, soccer, tennis, and table tennis as they faced off against @UNNCHome and @DukeKunshan for the Sino-Foreign University Cup! 🏆 https://shanghai.nyu.edu/news/nyu-shanghai-hosts-2nd-leg-sino-foreign-university-cup
